reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the collection of various types of personal information, indicating that the app declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: We do not use or disclose sensitive personal information without your consent or for the purposes of inferring characteristics about you. With your consent we share personal information for the purpose of engaging in advertising and marketing activities. URL: https://happinessproject.com/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects contact details, order information, account information, shopping information, device information, browser information, network connection information, IP address, and other information related to the user's interaction with the services.

content: Other information related to user's interaction with the services

reply.analysis: The answer was derived by extracting the types of data explicitly mentioned in the privacy policy document from the section describing the information collected directly from users and users' interaction with the services.
reply.reference:
Contact details including your name, address, phone number, and email.
Order information including your name, billing address, shipping address, payment confirmation, email address, and phone number.
Account information including your username, password, security questions and other information used for account security purposes.
Shopping information including the items you view, put in your cart, saved into your account like loyalty points, reviews, referrals or gift cards.
Information about how you access and use our Site and your account, including device information, browser information, information about your network connection, your IP address and other information regarding your interaction with the Services.
URL: https://happinessproject.com/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.
reply.reference: How We Use Your Personal Information - Providing Products and Services. We use your personal information to provide you with the Services in order to perform our contract with you, including to process your payments, fulfill your orders, to send notifications to you related to your account, purchases, returns, exchanges or other transactions, to create, maintain and otherwise manage your account, to arrange for shipping, facilitate any returns and exchanges and other features and functionalities related to your account. URL: https://happinessproject.com/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data. The privacy policy mentions that users have the right to request the deletion of personal information maintained by the app.

reply.analysis: Based on the information provided in the privacy policy document, users have the option to request the deletion of their personal information maintained by the app, which indicates that they can opt out of data collection or delete data.
reply.reference: Right to Delete: You may have a right to request that we delete personal information we maintain about you. If you would like to exercise any of the rights available to you, please call or email us at joey@happinessproject.com or contact us at 538 N York Rd, Bensenville, IL, 60106, US. URL: https://happinessproject.com/policies/privacy-policy

- Right of Portability: You may have a right to receive a copy of the personal information we hold about you a...

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties for contract fulfillment purposes, legitimate purposes, and other reasons stated in the privacy policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with third parties for various purposes such as contract fulfillment, legitimate purposes, and other reasons detailed in the policy.
reply.reference: In certain circumstances, we may disclose your personal information to third parties for contract fulfillment purposes, legitimate purposes and other reasons subject to this Privacy Policy. Such circumstances may include: - With vendors or other third parties who perform services on our behalf (e.g., IT management, payment processing, data analytics, customer support, cloud storage, fulfillment and shipping). URL: https://happinessproject.com/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with vendors, IT management, payment processors, data analytics providers, customer support services, cloud storage services, fulfillment and shipping services, business and marketing partners including Shopify, social media widgets, login integrations, affiliates, corporate group, and in connection with business transactions like mergers or bankruptcies.

content: Business and marketing partners including Shopify
Parties involved in business transactions like mergers or bankruptcies

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions sharing data with multiple third parties for various purposes such as IT services, payment processing, advertising, shipping, and more.

URL: https://happinessproject.com/policies/privacy-policy
